thread.title: Win VIP tickets to rugby dinner: Terms, Conditions
thread.title_full: Win VIP tickets to rugby dinner: Terms, Conditions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Win VIP tickets to rugby dinner: Terms, Conditions
text: Prize Draw Terms and Conditions 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), and Vitality Corporate Services Limited (“Vitality”), their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. Entries must be submitted via www.telegraph.co.uk/vitalityrugby and entry is restricted to one per person. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winners will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winners’ names and counties can be obtained by sending a sae to Rugby Captains Dinner VIP Tickets Winners, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by midnight on Sunday 13 September 2015. 6. The winners will be contacted by the Promoter by telephone by 5pm on Monday September 14, 2015. Should the Promoter be unable to contact a winner by this deadline or should a winner be unable to accept their prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award that prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prizes as described are available on the date of publication. Should the prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value will be provided. 8. Three winning entrants will each win a pair of VIP tickets to the Rugby Captains Dinner, which will be held on Wednesday, September 16, 2015 at Battersea Evolution, London from 6.30pm. VIP tickets include: • Telegraph Bespoke champagne reception • Private Q&A with the six rugby captains • Three-course meal designed by award winning Angela Hartnett • Hearing expert predictions and insights into the forthcoming 2015 World Cup • Exclusive live entertainment • Access to aftershow party until 2am (carriages from 10pm). 9. The winners must take their prize as one package. 10. The prize does not include travel to or from the event, accommodation personal expenditure or incidental costs. 11. The prizes are subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 12. The winners may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of Vitality and the Promoter. 13. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 14. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prizes impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter. Accordingly the Promoter may, at its absolute discretion, vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 15. The Telegraph is responsible for the publication, administration and adjudication of the prize draw and for provision of the prizes. 16. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT. telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraph
